result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel S ONeill was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Chenequa Police Dept.   Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
**ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel meeting on 08/10/2016
Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Not to drive without a valid driver's license. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Comply with any Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Proposed stipulation and order to amend JOC.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.
Dated 08/04/16, from DOC to Judge Carter, requesting clarification of sentence.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.

Defendant Daniel S ONeill in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties review PSI. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Scholz makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #1:

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 2 days)	***CONSECUTIVE TO 15CF1106***
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS	***CONCURRENT TO 15CF1106***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____Only drive with a valid Driver's License
____Attend Victim Impact Panel on 08/10/16

D/L REVOCATION: 36 months (CONCURRENT TO 15CF1106)
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months (CONCURRENT TO 15CF1106)

FINE :  $1569.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation, any cash bond posted to be refunded to bail poster)

BLOOD DRAW FEE: $35.00

CONDITION TIME: 6 MONTHS HUBER, with standard release conditions, to commence forthwith	***CONSECUTIVE TO 15CF1106***

Defendant  is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Court wishes to have presentence investigation and orders such.  Court adjourns sentencing.  Bail remains as fixed.
